quoridor.model

Class MoveCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • quoridor.model.MoveCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class MoveCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    MoveCalculator class. Contains all the useful methods of the game that manage the players moves, by determining if they are legal. This class contains the browsing algorithm which ensure that moves fit the game's rules.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • updatePossibleWalls

        public void updatePossibleWalls()
        Updates the possibleWalls ArrayList, used by both players, by browsing through all the grid coordinates to check each possible wall to put on the grid.

      • thereIsNoWall

        public boolean thereIsNoWall(int x,
                             int y,
                             Square[][] g)
        Check if there is already a wall or not
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the future wall
        y - the y coordinate of the future wall
        g - the grid
        Returns:
        true if there is not wall and false if there is wall

      • isLegalWall

        public boolean isLegalWall(int x,
                           int y)
        Browses through the possibleWalls ArrayList corresponding to the given player, to check if the wall move with the given coordinates is in it, which means that placing this wall is possible.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the wall move
        y - the y-coordinate of the wall move
        Returns:
        true is the wall move is possible, false otherwise

      • isLegalPawn

        public boolean isLegalPawn(int x,
                           int y,
                           Player player)
        Browses through the possibleMoves ArrayList corresponding to the given player, to check if the move with the given coordinates is in it, which means that the move is possible.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the move
        y - the y-coordinate of the move
        player - the player that made the move
        Returns:
        true is the move is possible, false otherwise

        Parameters:

      • checkPawnMove

        private boolean checkPawnMove(int x,
                              int y,
                              Player player,
                              Square[][] g,
                              boolean first)
        Checks if the given move respects the game rules and can be placed. This method contains the algorithm that checks the grid to determines if the move fit the rules.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the move
        y - the y-coordinate of the move
        player - the player that made the move
        g - the grid where there is moves
        first - this method is semi recursif. First is boolean for check is there is the first call of this method or not (first time : true , second time : false)
        Returns:
        false if there is no move possible

      • checkWall

        private boolean checkWall(int x,
                          int y)
        Checks if the given wall move respects the game rules and can be placed. This method contains the algorithm that checks the grid to determines if the wall move fit the rules.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the wall move
        y - the y-coordinate of the wall move
        Returns:
        true is the wall move is possible, false otherwise

      • explore

        private boolean explore(Player player,
                        Board cloneBoard,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Pair> mark)
        Recursif method. This method allow to check if the position of the wall is correct or not.
        Parameters:
        player - Check if this player can exit and win
        cloneBoard - a clone of the board (you can modify it without risk)
        mark - ArrayList with all mark vertex
        Returns:
        true if it is a good wall position and false if it isn't
